intro: Canscora parishii, commonly known as the Paraguay nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Canscora parishii is typically found in moist, shaded areas in tropical and subtropical regions.
